thread.title: Area 4- Champs: Never-say-die Northgate lineup wins title
thread.title_full: Area 4- Champs: Never-say-die Northgate lineup wins title

title: Area 4- Champs: Never-say-die Northgate lineup wins title
text:
Comments 
PEACHTREE CITY -- The postseason is all about playing your best at the right time. And right now, the timing of Northgate’s volleyball team couldn’t be more perfect. Capping off three victories against state-ranked opponents on a busy final day of the Area 4- tournament at McIntosh, the Lady Vikings stunned the host Lady Chiefs in a three sets to one victory to capture this year’s region championship. The victory over McIntosh, the No. 6-ranked team in Class , gives Northgate a well-earned No. 1 seed in the state tournament beginning Thursday at home against the No. 4 finisher out of Area 6- . It also gives the Lady Vikings (26-17) a huge shot of confidence after finishing 11-2 within one of the toughest areas in the state. Junior Katie Stanton finished four matches with 34 kills and 8 aces in a balanced effort from a veteran lineup led by senior captains Savannah Moore (30 kills, 27 blocks) and Taylor Richard (32 kills, 28 digs) in impressive efforts. Senior libero Cara Rhoad posted 30 digs and junior Kia Thomas posted double digits in both kills (25) and blocks (11). Setters Morgan Marshall and Delaney Surapine closed Saturday with 59 and 51 assists, respectively while showcasing the Lady Vikings’ depth at the position. Along with Moore and Thomas, junior Hannah Smith was strong up front with seven blocks. Needing a win to reach the finals, Northgate bounced back from a two-game sweep by host McIntosh in the winner’s bracket semifinal to defeat Ola (39-8)-- the No. 7 ranked team in -- for the second time on Saturday. The Lady Indians opened the final day of the tournament by rallying past the Lady Mustangs 22-25, 25-23, 27-25 in a thriller to get a first crack at McIntosh. With Ola looking to avenge its loss to Northgate, the Lady Vikings again stood tall in a three-set victory, winning 25-13, 23-25, 25-22 to reach the area championship. . The Lady Vikings opened tournament play on Thursday with a pair of sweeps, beating Union Grove 25-21, 25-19 and Mundy’s Mill 25-19, 25-7. More
